meanings.definition: To take in or soak up liquid or other substances.
meanings.sent1: The sponge absorbed all the water from the sink.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel quickly absorbed the spilled juice.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty soil eagerly absorbed the rain, quenching its thirst.
meanings.sent4: Her mind absorbed the knowledge like a dry sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The black hole seemed to absorb all light, creating a mysterious darkness.

meanings.definition: To fully engage or occupy one's attention.
meanings.sent1: The captivating story absorbed the children's interest completely.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling movie absorbed the audience's focus from start to finish.
meanings.sent3: The video game was so absorbing that he lost track of time while playing.
meanings.sent4: Her book absorbed me so much that I forgot about everything else around me.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance was so absorbing that the entire audience was spellbound.

meanings.sent1: She absorbed the lesson quickly and aced the test.
meanings.sent2: The students absorbed the new concept after a few examples.
meanings.sent3: The detective absorbed all the clues and finally solved the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His curious mind absorbed every detail of the historical documentary.
meanings.sent5: The young scientist absorbed knowledge like a sponge, always eager to learn more.
